dialogue:
Person1: You're the one who's a good boy. Man say "fetch" and you fetch--
Person2: Just doing my job.
Person1: White man just using you to keep the Black man down.
Person2: This isn't Houston, my friend. We pretty much running things now. Our good day has come.
Person1: You suckers haven't had a good day since the Alamo.

Person1: You lied to me about those school books. I found them upstairs on your bed.
Person2: What were you doing in my room?
Person1: I was looking for that blue sweater that you borrowed which I found balled up in the bottom of your closet. Now why did you lie to me? Where did you go?
Person2: I had to see Bobby. I know you really don't like Bobby, but there was a problem and I didn't think you would understand.
Person1: Oh, honey, you don't have to lie to me. Ever. You can tell me anything. I'll understand.
Person2: I'm sorry, Mom.
Person1: Now hurry, dinner's almost ready. Your father says he's starving.

Person1: Large?
Person2: All right, cop. I want my money.
Person1: It's still my money. If you want to have a chance at any part of it, shithead, you will take my $120,000 and bet on tomorrow's game.
Person2: What about the money you owe me on yesterday's game?
Person1: Forget yesterday's game. The World Series is seven games not six. Put in my bet.
Person2: Let me think about it.
Person1: There's nothing to think about. Either you put in my bet or you ain't getting nothing.

Person1: You might regret this, Mr Rothstein.
Person2: I'll regret it even more if I keep you on.
Person1: This is not the way to treat people.
Person2: Listen, if you didn't know you're bein' scammed, you're too dumb to keep this job. If you did know, you were in on it. Either way, you're out!  Get out! Go on.  Let's go.

Person1: She has no idea who I am.
Person2: Why are you following me?
Person1: I'm trying to help you. I knew she'd get her claws into you. She doesn't know anything about your investigation, so when she offers to help you, it'll be for her own reasons. Why would I lie? Do not go back to her. Take out a pen, write yourself a note, do not trust her.

Person1: I like you, kid. Why do you gotta make it so hard for me to take care of you?
Person2: Mr. Reuben, I swear to God, they were out of line.
Person1: Last time, maybe, with the Puerto Ricans, but these were nice Jewish boys.
Person2: They were out of line --
Person1: They're yeshiva buchas. You didn't have to tear up the goddamn place. You knocked out a guys teeth.
Person2: That prick tried to get Jessica to do inappropriate things in the bathroom --
Person1: Bobby, I love Jessica like she's my own daughter. I would kill anyone so much as lays a finger on her or her beautiful daughter, but that pisher you socked in the mouth has the most expensive dentist in Beverly Hills and wants I should buy him an implant. Your silverback horseshit's gonna cost me eight grand.
Person2: I'll work it off.
Person1: Not driving Jess, you won't.
Person2: What?
Person1: You're not driving Jess no more. Two strikes, Bobby, and this last one was big. The bachelor's father goes to my schul.
Person2: So, that's it. I'm out?
Person1: I didn't say that.
Person2: Then what are you saying?
Person1: Bobby. You're a bull terrier and I got you herding sheep.
Person2: I don't understand.
Person1: It's my fault. I send you out to watch scum drool all over the love of your life, then I wonder why you seered. It's my fault. The tooth is on me. But no more. I'm 'reassigning' you.
Person2: I don't want to drive another girl, Max. The only reason I'm --
Person1: Who do you think you're talking to? This ain't a democracy. You want out?
Person2: No.
Person1: Don't I put food on you're table? I sponsor your training, I take care of your girl and her little baby. I even pay that deadbeat friend of yours to push a goddamn broom.
Person2: I know.
Person1: Now you wanna shut up and listen and hear what I got to say?
Person2: Yeah. Sorry.
Person1: I got a way we make everybody happy.
Person2: Yeah.
Person1: We try something out. There's someone I'm in business with named Ruiz. I want you to accompany him on a drop.  Just as scenery. Ruiz has his boys. I just want a big guinea with a busted up face to give him a deep bench. As a deterrent.
Person2: Ruiz knows about this?
Person1: Ruiz wants to go alone, but it's not up to Ruiz. It's up to me, and I like a sure thing. Just go and we're square on the tooth.
Person2: What about Ricky? He'd jump at the opportunity.
Person1: Ricky? Ricky 'I lost the truck' Ricky?
Person2: You told him you liked him.
Person1: That was before he lost my carpet cleaning van.
Person2: He'll work it off.
Person1: I don't know the kid, and what little I do scares me.
Person2: He's good people, Mr. Reuben. I swear.
Person1: You vouch for him?

Person1: I don't know what kind of game you're playing here but I'm out because you are a whack-job.
Person2: He was working on something called Project Manticore, which was using recombinant DNA to produce a superior human...a warrior...an advanced infantry soldier.
Person1: Not that I don't enjoy a good urban legend now and then but what does any of this have to do with me?
Person2: The bar code on your neck, Max.  I know who you are and I know who you're running from.

Person1: What do you want?
Person2: I want to sit.  I want to talk to you.
Person1: Don't sit down.
Person2: ...I want to....I want so many things, Claudia. Maybe we can just talk to straighten our things out....there are so many things that I want to tell you --
Person1: I don't wanna talk to you.
Person2: Please.  It doesn't have to be now. Maybe we can make a date to sit down, I didn't mean to walk in on you like this --
Person1: Why are you here, why are you doing this? Coming in here -- you wanna call me a whore?
Person2: I don't want you to think that I'm that way to you -- I'm not gonna call you a slut or something --
Person1: Yeah, yeah right -- what are you doing?  WHAT ARE YOU DOING IN MY HOUSE?
Person2: Don't yell, honey.  Please don't go crazy --
Person1: I'M NOT CRAZY.  Don't you tell me I'm crazy.
Person2: I'm not saying that, I'm sorry --
Person1: I'M NOT CRAZY.  You're the one.  You're the one who's wrong.  You're the one --
Person2: I have something, so much -- I'm sick, Claudia. I'm sick.
Person1: Get out of here, get out of my house --
Person2: Now STOP IT and LISTEN to me right now. I AM DYING, I GOT SICK...now I fell down and I'm Not...DON'T --
Person1: GET OUT.
Person2: I'm dying, Claudia.  I have cancer. I have cancer and I'm dying, soon. It's metastasized in my bones and I --
Person1: LEAVE. YOU LEAVE, YOU GET OUT.
Person2: I'm not lying to you, I'm not --
Person1: GET OUT.
Person2: baby, please, please --
Person1: I'M NOT YOUR BABY, I'M NOT YOUR GIRL. I'm not your baby --

Person1: Want to dance?
Person2: Dance? Here?
Person1: Why not?
Person2: They know you here--know your name.
Person1: I know everybody. I don't look at half of life, just the nice half, I look at all of it.

Person1: Jack and Bobby are good men. But it takes a certain character, moral toughness to stand up to --
Person2: -- You listen to me. Nobody, nobody, talks about my friends that way. You're here right now because of the Kennedys. They may be wrong. They make mistakes. But they're not weak. The weak ones are these 'people' who can't speak their own minds.
Person1: You know I don't mean they're weak.

Person1: Jamie, I'm sorry. I didn't mean it like that. I can go out with Brady tomorrow night. Its no big deal.
Person2: But you wanted to go out tonight. It's my fault that you can't.
Person1: Well tonight we're going to do something better. We're going to go trick-or-treating.
Person2: I don't want to.
Person1: It's Halloween. I mean don't you want to get dresses up in a really scary costume and get some candy?

Person1: We're not going to get a ride tonight.
Person2: I can't stay on this planet.
Person1: No one's traveling in this weather.
Person2: You promised you would get me to my ship.
Person1: I will. I will. We still have another day.
Person2: You promised.
Person1: What do you want from me? There are no cars on this road. I didn't ask for this stupid storm.

Person1: What do you mean you and my father decided? Who the hell are you to plan my life? Let's get married and live happily ever after. Bullshit. I got knocked up. I had to marry you. I never had a choice.
Person2: What?
Person1: You betrayed me, Charlie. You were never there for me or the children. And now you come and tell me, "Peggy, you're scared." Of course I'm scared. If you knew what I knew you'd be scared shitless.
Person2: You're crazy! You're really out of your mind!
Person1: I might be crazy, but I'm not crazy enough to marry you twice. There's a lot of things I can't change. I can't even think about them. I tried. But I couldn't even help Rosalie.  I don't want to be bitter. I'm a naturally optimistic person. But you took advantage of that.

Person1: Is it true that you launched an attack on Paris?
Person2: I tried to.
Person1: It was on a Sunday, wasn't it?
Person2: I don't remember.  Maybe.
Person1: Do you think is was a good idea to launch an attack on a holy day?
Person2: I don't know...
Person1: And didn't you order the citizens of Paris to surrender the city in the name of the King of Heaven?
Person2: No... I said "Surrender in the name of the King of France"...
Person1: That is not what is written in the evidence... look for yourself!

Person1: Thank you.
Person2: And, um ...I guess... I guess you and I, uh...
Person1: Adam?  Don't even think about it. Okay? I'm sorry.  I know that sounds mean, but believe me, it would be meaner if I didn't say it. Okay?
Person2: Okay.
Person1: Now, let's take the truck back and get something to eat.

Person1: When my back gets better I'mma beat the black off you, Day-Day.
Person2: I know.  I'm sorry.
Person1: Sorry, my ass.

Person1: Don't be an ass, Auggie. He's trying to make it up to you, can't you see that?
Person2: He's crazy.
Person1: No, he's not. You are.
Person2: You're right. I just wasn't sure you knew.
Person1: It's written all over you like a neon sign. Now say something nice to Rashid to make him feel better.
Person2: Forget you, kid.

Person1: If you ask me... I'll say, "yes."
Person2: There are lots of reason... I had a thought that if you had sex with Simon it might...
Person1: Sex with Simon?
Person2: It's one idea...
Person1: That's why you brought me? Look at me! Is that really why you brought me... Like I'm a what and I owe you what?!
Person2: I don't know why I brought you -- that idea occurred to me is all... It came out first... Hey, you kiss him -- me... He says he loves you. You two hit it off. But you don't want to... fine... Forget what I said about sex with Simon. It was a mistake.
Person1: I'll never forget you said it.
Person2: It was a mistake.

Person1: After all I've done, I can’t believe you’re doubting my motives!
Person2: It's just hard to believe you suddenly care when you've been distant for so long.
Person1: I've been going through things, Mia. That doesn't mean I don't care.
Person2: I need consistent effort, Eli, not just moments of clarity.

Person1: Rose.
Person2: Kitty...
Person1: Rose, we have a crisis.  I am sure that you are aware of the horrible allegations against Jim Cunningham.
Person2: Yes, I saw the news. Something about a kiddie-porn dungeon.
Person1: Please! Don't say those words.  Well... as you can see... many of us are devastated by this news. This is obviously some kind of conspiracy meant to destroy an innocent man. And I have taken it upon myself to spearhead the Jim Cunningham defence campaign. But unfortunately my civic duties have created a conflict of interest... which involves you.
Person2: Beg pardon?
Person1: Rose... I have to appear at his arraignment tomorrow morning. And as you know, the girls also leave for Los Angeles tomorrow morning. Now, as their coach... I was the obvious choice to chaperone them on the trip.
Person2: But now you can't go.
Person1: Yes. And believe me, of all the other mothers I would never dream of asking you, given the predicament with your son. But none of the other mothers are able to go.
Person2: Oh, Kitty, I don't know. This is so last-minute... Eddie is in New York...
Person1: Rose... I don't know if you realise how great an opportunity this is for our daughters. This has been a dream of ours for a long time.  Sometimes I doubt your commitment to Sparkle Motion.

Person1: Your pen palls dead, lady.
Person2: If you say that, if you keep saying that, they will kill you. If they think you're not you, they will kill you. Don't you see? I know what you're doing, but it won't work!
Person1: Nick died for me....
Person2: I won't let him hurt you! He just wants what you know!
Person1: ...maybe I die for Nick...
Person2: Just tell him what you know, Nick! That's all they want! And we'll get out of this!

Person1: ...The juice is climbin' every week.
Person2: I know the juice is climbin' -- I been workin' six months just to pay the damn interest.
Person1: Ya still light seventy.
Person2: Waits! -- Be smart. Ya don't have to break nothin' -- Here, take my coat, it's worth fifty-sixty dollars. It's yours.

Person1: Wait I...
Person2: You were paid to take me out!  By -- the one person I truly hate.  I knew it was a set-up!
Person1: It wasn't like that.
Person2: Really?  What was it like?  A down payment now, then a bonus for sleeping with me?
Person1: I didn't care about the money.

Person1: Take me down there.
Person2: It won't do any good. They are a pair of would-be mur- deresses fighting it out.
Person1: Man, you're crazy. What kind of a place is this?
Person2: Oh, I'm crazy, am I? Let me tell you something.  Those women have--the gleam--
Person1: Come on, we're wasting time.

Person1: I'll tell you what happens if you lose... you tell the truth for once.
Person2: What are you talkin' about?
Person1: You tell me what Ganz busted out for, he's after a lot more than just gettin' out of jail.  And whatever it is, you're part of it.
Person2: I don't know what you're talking about. I just wanna see Ganz nailed.
Person1: The bet's off.

Person1: Well that's why I'm here, Mr. Dean. 'Cause you're a labor lawyer.
Person2: Good point.
Person1: Last night, Larry Spinks, he works the Steel Press, he goes to a bar with his wife Rosalie to have a glass of chianti 'cause it's his birthday, and these two guys, these Guido guys, they jump him when he goes to the bathroom.
Person2: L.T., in this office I'd prefer you say Italian-Americans.
Person1: I'm sorry, Mr. Dean. But Larry's in St. Lukes now, so I'm a little--I'm not myself. The Union bosses say unless we take Bellmoth's offer, it'll only get worse.
Person2: That's because your Union bosses are those Guido guys.
Person1: I don't under--
Person2: The Union's trying to railroad you into accepting terms worse than what you have now.
Person1: Why would the Union--

Person1: Veronica! Color me stoked, girl. I've gotten everyone to sign this petition even the one who think BigFun are tuneless Eurofags. People love me!  My God, you haven't signed!
Person2: People love you but I know you. Jennifer Forbes told me the petition she signed was to put a jacuzzi in the cafeteria. And Doug Hylton...
Person1: So some people need different kinds of "convincing" than others....  Hey, just sign the petition!
Person2: Don't talk to me like that.
Person1: It was J.D.'s idea! He made out the signature sheet and everything. Now will you sign it?
Person2: No.
Person1: Jealous much?

Person1: How was it?
Person2: Why didn't you tell me about this staff meeting?
Person1: Nobody told me anything.
Person2: What good are you if you don't tell me stuff like this?
Person1: It wasn't my fault.  If I would have known, I would have known.

Person1: Well, then I do apologize... But what I'm most sorry for is turning you into a spoiled brat who can only think about what she's feeling... who can't admit when she's wrong and who can't forgive when she's not.
Person2: LEAVE ME ALONE!!

Person1: I've been doing a lot of thinking, and I believe it's best for both of us if we spend some time apart.
Person2: Are you serious? After everything we've been through together?
Person1: It's not about our past, David. It's about what's best for our futures.
Person2: Samantha, you can't live without me. You know that deep down.
Person1: I guess we'll find out. I need this space to grow and reflect.

Person1: You'll never have another chance to hit me again.  I never knew till this minute -
Person2: Susan, it seems to me -
Person1: Don't tell me you're sorry.
Person2: I'm not sorry.
Person1: I'm going to leave you.
Person2: No, you're not.
Person1: Yes.

Person1: Come on, daddy, pull my coat. What happens if you give all that up? You get sick or somethin'? I pulled a hustle once and got out of the draft.
Person2: I'm telling you God's words, not no hustle. I'm talking the words of Elijah, the black man's God. I'm telling you, boy, that God is black.
Person1: What? Everybody knows God is White.
Person2: But everything the white man taught you, you learned. He told you you were a black heathen and you believed him. He told you how he took you out of darkness and brought you to the light. And you believed him. He taught you to worship a blond, blue-eyed God with white skin -- and you believed him. He told you black was a curse, you believed him. Did you ever look up the word black in the dictionary?
Person1: What for?
Person2: Did you ever study anything wasn't part of some con?
Person1: What the hell for, man?
Person2: Go on, fool; the marble shooters are waiting for you.
Person1: Okay, okay. Show me, man.

Person1: You're alive! She didn't kill you!
Person2: Who didn't?
Person1: That woman who's after me. She hates you. Because she knows I love you.
Person2: You love me?
Person1: My angel. My goddess. I feel I've always loved you all my life. I'll die if I can't spend the rest of my life just looking at you, holding you in my arms...
Person2: We have to have a long talk about all this.
Person1: I know just the place. Hang a left at the Amalgamated Tower.

Person1: You planning on going somewhere, Eduardo?  You don't like it here? This is the best situation you're going to have for a long, long time.
Person2: I am a legitimate business.  Fishing boats.  Tuna.  Check it out.  Tax records, everything --
Person1: Listen you jerk, you tried to kill me with a cannon.
Person2: You can't visit me here.  I want my lawyer.
Person1: The amount of coke we got on you means capital punishment in some states.

Person1: And never take.
Person2: Look, I'm sorry about your plane.  But I couldn't risk being late into Memphis.
Person1: Forget it.
Person2: You know General McLelland, he wouldn't attack unless he had everything just right.  Finally Abe Lincoln came to him and said, General, if you're not going to use my army, could I borrow it for a while?  So he gave it to Grant and Grant just said, let's go.
Person1: I'm from Arkansas.  Tell me a story with Robert E. Lee in it and maybe I'll pay attention.
Person2: We're warriors, not desk jockeys.  We've got to be bold.  You always want all your ducks lined up.  But nothing's 100 percent.  It's always 60-40, maybe 51-49. Hell, I'd take 40-60.  Then roll the dice.
Person1: That's why you're a gambling man.
Person2: That's why I'm running foreign and you're not.  That's why you're not married and I am.
Person1: For the third time.
Person2: Take the plunge, admit your mistakes, move on to tomorrow.  That's FedEx, that's women, that's life.

Person1: Something was making me talk. Some Goddamn thing was making me move. I gotta get out of here.
Person2: Oh, Dollface, it was just your passion for me taking hold.
Person1: No, Dollface, I know what my passion taking hold feels like. I gotta go.

Person1: Every time I share my feelings, you dismiss them or change the topic.
Person2: I'm just not good with emotional stuff, Mara.
Person1: That's no excuse. You don’t love me, do you?
Person2: That's not true. I do love you, but I need to learn how to express it better.

Person1: I don't know who you think you're talking to! I ain't some whore you brought here! I've been trying to be your friend and you treat me like shit!
Person2: Be a friend. Leave.
Person1: You got no manners and you never tell the truth! You're nothin' special. And if you ask me, you got no chance at all of being an officer!

Person1: I'll tell you something, Annie -- I stood there looking at what was happening to that horse... And, I swear, it felt like the same thing was happening to me.
Person2: I don't understa-
Person1: And I have two choices. I can either fight the way things are, or accept them.  See, I always knew I loved you more. Didn't bother me. I always felt lucky... a little amazed... that such a vibrant, beautiful woman would want to be with a man like me... And I guess I thought as long as I did everything right -- if I was the best husband I could be, the best father... even being a good lawyer only mattered to me because of what it meant for us... if I could do all that, it wouldn't make any difference if we loved each other the same or not... I wasn't asking for more. I told myself I didn't need more.  But you don't know how you feel about me. You don't know... if you want a life with me anymore...  And I don't want you to come home until you do know...  ... one way or the other.

Person1: You gotta help me. Okay? This girl I told you about? Diana? She's from the Five Towns. She's Jewish. She won't go out with me alone. Can you believe this shit? She's prejudiced, but she's built. She's never been out with an Italian before. She says she'll only go out on a double date with her girlfriend.  You believe this shit? But you gotta see her. I mean, she's beautiful.
Person2: Will you get out of here.
Person1: Is it my fault she won't go out without her girlfriend?  For Chrissake.  Come on.  You don't even have to stay.  Jeesuz!  What's the big deal?
Person2: Tommy  ...

Person1: Empty the gun onto the table, very carefully.
Person2: Look, I don't know what this...
Person1: Shut up, cunt!  Do exactly as I say, or I'll put this arrow through your throat.

Person1: Calm down.
Person2: I vouched for you. I vouched for you and you messed me up.
Person1: This shit's peanuts compared to what we're gonna make with Maxie.
Person2: Ricky. I'm trying to save this money. Understand? I'm trying to make it so my girlfriend doesn't have to grind her ass into other men's erections so her daughter can go to private school.
Person1: I'm sorry...
Person2: This is horseshit. It coulda been so easy.
Person1: It's gonna be fine.
Person2: No more, man.
Person1: Let's get some sleep. That's what we need, man. Sleep.
Person2: How we gonna sleep? We only got a few hours til dinner.
Person1: So what do we do?
Person2: Let's just go now and wait.
Person1: Three and a half hours?
Person2: I don't want to take any more chances.
Person1: Let's just go get guns, I'd feel better.
Person2: Don't mess around. You're gonna get us all killed.
Person1: Think about it. You knocked out that Jewish kid's tooth, cost him eight grand, maybe more. Maybe lost his whole line of clientele? He knows you're fucking up Jess' dancing, and I got a feeling he knows I stole his carpet cleaning van by the way he looks at me. He can't kill us in LA cause that leads to too many questions. So he flies us out here first class for a "drop" that's turned into whatever? He can make us disappear out here real nice...
Person2: Where do you get this shit?
Person1: Scenario B. I think I'm getting under Ruiz's skin. I'm no dummy. He doesn't like how it went down with the Red Drag -- Welshman, whatever. Now I got Fruitpie the Magician telling me I can't call my man Max? And that Welshman's sketchy.  Whatever, I don't know where it's coming, which way it's coming from, I'm telling you one thing right now, I'm not gonna be late for the dance.
Person2: You're not getting a gun.

Person1: Paul, I know you've been out.
Person2: What?
Person1: You've been out of your room.
Person2: No, I haven't.
Person1: Paul, my little ceramic penguin in the study always faces due south.
Person2: I don't know what you're talking about.

Person1: Look we gave you what you asked for.  It checks out didn't it?! What more do you want from us!
Person2: I told you not to try anything smart!  I guess you're too much of a maverick to follow a simple order!  And that's just too bad for all of you now, isn't it?
Person1: Look you said it doesn't matter to you anyway!  Why do you want to kill more innocent people!  Why!

Person1: I did something stupid. I had a courier job -- picking up a package from the airport. It turned out to be money -- so I kind of borrowed it to pay my rent and now these dudes are after me.
Person2: So pay them back and apologize.
Person1: These guys aren't the kind that'll take an apology. They're the kind that'll break my thumbs.
Person2: You think that story's gonna make me loan you money?
Person1: It's the truth. If you'd just loaned me the money last time this never would have happened.
Person2: Somehow this winds up being my fault? You always blame me.
Person1: Come on, I'm your biggest supporter.
Person2: My bra is my biggest supporter.
Person1: I just need a place to lay low for a few days. Come on, I know you hate me but you can't wanna see me at the bottom of the East River?

Person1: Hey, remember that time you borrowed a hundred bucks from me and promised to pay it back by the end of the month?
Person2: Hmm, I don't recall that ever happening.
Person1: Seriously? We were at Joe's party, and you were practically begging for it.
Person2: Joe's party? Oh, that was such a crazy night. But I really don't remember any borrowing.
Person1: Come on, it was just last month. You even said you'd pay me back with interest.
Person2: Interest? Are you sure you're not mixing me up with someone else? I think you might be mistaken.
Person1: I distinctly remember you promising, and I could use that money now.
Person2: I wish I could help, but I don't recall that ever happening. Maybe it was someone else who borrowed from you.
Person1: Fine, forget it. But you better remember next time when you need a favor from me.
Person2: Oh, don't worry, I'll remember when it suits me.

Person1: Who are you?
Person2: My name's Lydia.  And it seems you and I have a lot in common.
Person1: You said you knew where my fiance was the other night.
Person2: With me, where he's been after work, three, sometimes four nights a week for the last two months... We have what you might call an intimate relationship.
Person1: How do I know you're telling the truth?
Person2: He been sleeping in a T-shirt lately?  That's so you won't see the fingernail marks on his back.  Bet you didn't know your boyfriend finds a little pain exciting.  He didn't either...at first.
Person1: Look, I don't know what you want--
Person2: I thought it was important for you to know the facts.
Person1: And so should you.  Sketchy told me I could expect a visit from you.  I know all about how you threatened him.  That if he didn't break it off with me, you'd save him the trouble.
Person2: Oh?
Person1: Well, it's over between you and him. We're getting married next month.
Person2: How sweet.  Standing by your man, even after what he did.  You're a very understanding person.
Person1: Big part of loving someone's being able to forgive them.
Person2: You're also a fool.
Person1: I think you should go now.
Person2: Not before we get something straight you prissy little bitch.  I decide when I'm done with your boyfriend.  Not him, and certainly not you.  Unless maybe you want to find out just how sharp these nails really are.

Person1: Grace, I need you to come with me.
Person2: No, you're only going to hurt him some more.
Person1: He's not hurt. He's okay. Look at him.
Person2: No!

Person1: Why did they do all this for goodness sake?--what were they after?

Now, I'm leaving for Colorado to try to finish this and I want your good thoughts--because if I can make it work ...  I might just have something that I want on my tombstone.
